author: Corky Emrick
title: Lady Bulldogs cruise
text: Posted Oct. 14, 2015 at 11:02 PM Centreville was not a gracious quad host Wednesday night. The Lady Bulldogs swept Berrien Springs 25-10, 25-9, 25-9 and took three from Comstock 25-5, 25-14, 25-11. “We had two great wins tonight, the team showed up, each person fulfilled their role and we took care of business,” coach Melissa gales said. “The girls are focused and constantly working to improve their games.” Hannah Marchand had nine kills, 15 digs, six blocks, three aces and one assist, Carlee Odom had 12 aces and five digs, Bailee may had 15 kills, 11 digs, six aces and four blocks and Sara Lewis added seven digs and one kill. Madison Hunter had 20 assists, five digs, five aces, four kills and one block, Skyler DeMeyer had 11 assists, nine digs, six kills and two blocks, Kalee Schrock had nine digs, four aces and one assist, Hannah Rice added four aces, one kill, one dig and one block, Andrea Bell had six kills, two digs and one assist and Samara Schlabach had four digs and one kill. BCSquad at Parchment Both Bronson and Mendon volleyball teams battled at the BCSquad hosted by Parchment. The Lady Hornets opened with a loss to Buchanan25-14, 25-11, 23-25, 25-14. They them swept Parchment 25-17, 25-15, 25-18. “I thought we played reasonably well, Buchanan is a very good team,” coach Bill Trenary said. “I think sometimes we forget that these are student athletes.” Megann Leighton had 31 kills, two aces and two blocks, Kaley Smith had 59 digs and six aces, Cassie Plummer added 56 assists and seven aces and Brandy DeLeeuw had 19 kills and two blocks. Like Mendon, Bronson swept Parchment 25-14, 25-11, 25-17. Bronson then battled Buchanan, droping a five set match. The Lady Viking one the first game 25-21, lost game two 25-20, won the third 25-19, but lost the next two games 25-22, 16-14. “We played average against a very good Buchanan team,” coach Jean LaClair said. “We struggled in serve/receive and running through our tips. It was a good test for us, and I am glad to have played in a 5-set match. “It was a good learning experience, and we know we have some work to do before the state tournament begins,” LaClair added. Adyson Lasky had 29 digs and three aces, Alexa Ratkowski had 76 assists, 17 digs, 12 kills and three aces, Allie Sikorski added 27 digs, nine digs, six aces and two blocks and Ashton Wronikowski had four kills and two blocks. Jenna Smoker had five kills and two digs, Jill Pyles added 29 kills, six digs, two blocks and two aces, Kiana Mayer had 154 kills, four blocks, four digs and one assist, Kiera Lasky had 47 digs and three aces and Kirin Cekander recorded 45 digs, 23 kills, three aces and one block. Page 2 of 2 - Marcellus 25, 25, 21, 27 Decatur 21, 23, 25, 25 Marcellus captured their first divisional title in 24 years with a 25-21, 25-23, 21-25, 27-25 win over Decatur Tuesday night. “It definitely looked and sounded like there were more Marcellus fans in the stands than the hometown Decatur fans. The Atmosphere was electric and gave the match a championship feel,” coach Tony Hooley said. “I’m not sure how much more the girls had in their tanks. They were so nervous to start the match and were running on adrenaline most of the night. “While I’m not convinced it was our sharpest night, the girls played big when they needed to,” Hooley added. Rochelle Zachrich had 27 digs and one ace, Mackenzie Buck had five kills, four blocks and two digs, Elena Gemello added 31 digs, nine kills, three blocks and two assists and Helis Sala had 13 kills, nine digs, and two assists. Madison Fisher had 44 assists, 26 digs and two kills, Grace Mihills added five digs, four kills and two blocks, Jade Sibley had four digs and Aleyna Hutson 31 digs and 21 kills.
